website_summaries.verdict: This rugged bag has the space for everything you could possibly need in the outdoors and a well-organized system of pockets, so you don't have to rummage around looking for things.
pros: Designed to hold 3 days of supplies
Well organized pockets with several zipper compartments to keep gear organized
Expandable shove-it pocket between the main compartment and the front compartment of the bag
cons: Some users have complained that the bag straps are not comfortable when on your back

customer_reviews.title: Much smaller than described
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed because the dimensions and size is not as listed. I just measured the backpack and it's only 20" in height instead of 23" as described and only 2639 cubic inches capacity instead of 3342 as in their description. Will return for refund and not purchase from Amazon again. I will purchase directly from 5.11.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Zipper broke.
customer_reviews.text: Changing my review. I've used this bag about 4 times to carry clothes in. Went to open the zipper and it broke. Bought this for an upcoming deployment. Couldn't even hold up to a few peices of clothing let alone what a deployment had in store for it. 5.11 won't cover it because amazon is not an authorized dealer and it's outside of the 30 days for Amazon. I'm stuck with a 200 Dollar useless bag. What a joke.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan H.

customer_reviews.title: Lots of useful space and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: So far I have used the 5.11 Rush72 only for light loads and short hikes. It is comfortable to wear and its design enables it meet a variety of needs and cargo types. The many pockets of the outer pouch make it easy to organize and find small items. The main pouch also has subpouches to make it easy to find your stuff. It is such an improvement over my previous backpack that was a big bag with a small pouch on top; its mesh side pockets could not secure water bottles. The 5.11 side pockets can each hold a insulated bottle in zippered security plus it does have a pouch for a water bladder.
customer_reviews.author: Rodamu

customer_reviews.title: Zippers all failed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag as a "Bug-out" bag for our emergeny/hurricane kit. It was not over stuffed and kept in a closet under A/C. When I pulled it out to check contents in prep for a hurricane that was threatening, all the zippers had popped open on their own. They are all plastic and had just failed. tried a few things to see if I could fix the zippers but nothing worked. Had to throw it out. Just over a year old.
customer_reviews.author: Janiene

customer_reviews.title: almost useless..
customer_reviews.text: This now serves as my “get home” bag for business trips. Plenty of room for the novice prepper (the experts may be able to be more critical of this pack versus others). Plenty of pockets for organizing. My tarp, sleeping bag liner fits neatly between the main compartment and outer. My one complaint is comfort of lugging it around. The waist strap is poorly designed...almost useless...same is true for the chest strap.
customer_reviews.author: T. M. Ayers

customer_reviews.title: Not as large as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good backpack. It is well made, very durable, and it has many storage pockets. The stuff pouch is particularly convenient. I have two reservations. It was advertised as having a main compartment that is 24inches tall. This measurement only works when the pack is empty and folded flat, with the bottom folded in half. When fully loaded the main compartment I’d about 21 inches tall. It is a large pack, with many large auxiliary pockets, but it not as large as advertised. The second problem is that the shoulder straps dig into my neck somewhat. More annoying than uncomfortable, perhaps. Otherwise, a very good pack.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Dorward

customer_reviews.title: Best backpack, especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had a bad 5.11 product yet. I already owned this backpack but in green and for this price you aren't going to find a backpack with this carry capacity--one of the larger factors that I personally consider. The back padding is very comfortable, as well as the padded shoulder straps. The handle at the top hasn't torn on me yet and I've hauled mine around with a 40-50 lb load a few times by that handle. Us the molle makes it very modular. I stuff everything I can into mine before adding any molle attachments. Anyway, great backpack. I recommend it
customer_reviews.author: DJF

customer_reviews.title: I used this Daily
customer_reviews.text: I love the space. IT has nice pockets on the inside some even with zippers to help with organization. I carry a lot of gear daily and on the weekend. I was able to put everything that barely fit in my old bag in to this one. The shoulder straps are well padded. The back also has padding to prevent the items in it from slamming against your back when walking. I love the Molle as I have two 24 oz thermoses that do not fit on normal backpack drink holders but i am able to use a Molle holder and hook right on to this pack.
customer_reviews.author: deathknight8338

customer_reviews.title: Good bag
customer_reviews.text: I use this as my travel bag for out of towners and flights. I DO NOT CHECK luggage so this is perfect. I wasnt sure about these but everyone online seemed to like them so i took the plunge. Glad I did. With the quality it will most likely last me the rest of my life. I like that, Im a buy once cry once type but then I like to really get the mileage out of something. I honestly feel like this will make it the long haul (pun intended). I did wait and get one on sale and luckily it was coyote brown or whatever 5.11 calls their coyote brown.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Awesome back pack
customer_reviews.text: This pack organizes everything we need for an "emergency" go to pack. We wanted something larger than what we needed so we could find everything without unloading the entire pack and this one really fits the bill. Lots of compartments and add-on possibilities. Price has gone up quite a bit but still a well made quality bag. Also very comfortable. The next size lower is also very comfortable and it held all our stuff but we did not have spare room. With the 72 we have a lot of extra room.
customer_reviews.author: avid shopper

customer_reviews.title: Wife said heck no! Its to much for a backpack.
customer_reviews.text: So I have been looking at this pack now for year or so. Against my wife wishes due to the price last week I decided to pull the trigger and purchase it. When I received it she got it out the box and was blown away with the design and quality. It is worth every penny. From the little pockets in the inside to the extra large compartments. Now she is on me to order one for her. I love the backpack and can't wait to use it again.
customer_reviews.author: Christin Messinger

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this bag-Great for one bag travel!
customer_reviews.text: I have been on the lookout for a high quality bag to use for one bag travel, and this is it! Having familiarity with 5.11 I knew their products were of high quality and this bag did not disappoint. The color scheme is great, it has plenty of storage options and is as customizable as one would desire. The integrated back support is removable if you would desire and would also eliminate a good bit of the weight as well. My only complaint, is that the sternum buckle broke without warning or explanation, otherwise 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: M. Maestas

customer_reviews.title: Best BOB for the money
customer_reviews.text: In my search for MY perfect BOB/Travel bag, I poured over review after review of the Condor, 5.11, Maxpedition, and after watching hours of youtube videos on each series of bags, I settled on the RUSH series by 5.11. I wear the 5.11 brand pants and hats and love them. That was part of my decision. I am 5'4" and about 145. I am not a tiny girl and this bag fits like a glove. The straps including the waist straps are a lifesaver after loading the bag with 20+ lbs. It carries everything and then some including my SnugPak sleep system and tent.
customer_reviews.author: DrLoafer

customer_reviews.title: A backpack-lover's backpack.
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite pack of all time. There are some specialty packs like the Gregory Baltoro that I suppose I might prefer for very specific applications, but when it comes to what I want to carry everywhere I go all day every day for whatever purpose - the Rush 72 is where it's at. I have owned a Rush 12 for many years. I used and abused it. It might look a little worn, but functionally it is just about as good as new. Anyway; I'm just saying, I've got a thing for backpacks and this is the one that really satisfies me. My two cents.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great so far!
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is BIG! so much more room and I feel like it distributes the weight of all my gear so much better. Hope this backpack holds up well, I'll set an alarm for a year from now on this exact day and update everyone with more pictures and a brief description of how it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: jake blake

customer_reviews.title: Love this backpack
customer_reviews.text: Love this backpack. I used it as my primary "suitcase" during a three week trip to Europe - it was small enough to fit in the overhead bins on both airlines I took, yet large enough to hold three pair of pants, five shirts, jams, undies, socks, extra pair of shoes, travel guides and all the gifts I bought while over there. It was extremely comfortable to carry as designed, held up well, no issues with the zippers or any other moving part. I still continue to use this as a two or three day trip back for my business trips - I've gotten away from suitcases as this works much better for me. Would definitely recommend it!!
customer_reviews.author: Zzyzx91

customer_reviews.title: I'm so in love with the way it makes me feel
customer_reviews.text: Very freaking rugged. Level 3 backpack can carry so much. Shows very little wear and tear over a few months, only the non-slip pads for the lower back area are losing threading. I'm so in love with the way it makes me feel. I do however, kinda hate that semi-detachable back part where you can slide stuff in. Makes me wanna get the Rush 24. But oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Jeriel Minguillan

customer_reviews.title: Great pack
customer_reviews.text: Great pack large enough for more than over night but small enough for regular carry as well great pretension system and adjustments lots of pockets make it easy to organize things inside as well and move straps everywhere for customization the water proof I am not sure about and there are drain holes in almost the pockets to let water out but they would also let it in other than that an accent bag for the price
customer_reviews.author: richard duvall

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I own the rush 12, rush 24, and even the MOAB 6. All the packs are extremely comfortable! For some reason the Rush 72 is awful when it comes to comfortability. The weight distribution is off and the waist belt is a joke. If you want a 72 hour pack just buy an ALICE Pack. Not worth the back pain.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Witt

customer_reviews.title: POCKETS!!
customer_reviews.text: Pockets. You want pockets? Its got pockets, its got pockets IN pockets. Holly crap the pockets. I lost a travel pillow for a month in it. Thought i lost it in a hotel, nope in a pocket! The open soace between sections held a 64oz growler and a 3in1 coat while the rest had other crap im it. This thing is seriously great
customer_reviews.author: source

customer_reviews.title: Coolest Backpack EVER
customer_reviews.text: I'm in love with this backpack! I bought it just in case there is an emergency situation in which I need a bag ready to go but also as a travel backpack. The amount of pockets and features this backpack has is incredible and one of the main reasons I bought it! I can't wait to use it more! I'm a skinny 100 lb girl and I loved that this backpack can actually fit someone as small as a kid or someone like me! The added hip strap support saved me when I was walking around all day carrying everyone's water, jackets, essentials etc.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: BEST PACK FOR ANYTHING YOU WOULD NEED
customer_reviews.text: Best GO Bag I have owned so far! I have all the essential items plus more (Water " have not put a camel back in yet", Food "MREs", shelter, fire, medical, personal hygiene items, shovel, axe, small propane stove/cookware etc.) I would guess atleast a weeks supply for 1 person. It weighs in at 48.6lbs and with the padding and straps it has, it doesn't feel like much. It's really worth the money and it fits everything and anything you would need. The organization and fit for your items is very well done and can pretty much access everything with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Gino Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Great sized bag and durable
customer_reviews.text: I love this back pack. It is very durable I use it for the gym, work, and school. Its big enough for what I need, but for a couple textbooks and a laptop it may be too big. I do not think I will purchase any other backpack again. durable doesn't fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: Zachariah Franklin

customer_reviews.title: An outstanding pack!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this pack every single day for about a year. It has held up extremely well. It is laid out smart and makes organization of my items a breeze. I honestly can't think of a single thing to complain about.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: You may get something worse than what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: The bag that’s on the site and the one I received are two completely different bags. Although they are both rush 72 in name, I received an “updated design” which is far worse. There’s no internal compartments, most of the pouches have been replaced with molly attachments, there’s no shove it compartment, and the storage capacity is 43 liters instead of the 55 in the description. Overall very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Great product with superb support
customer_reviews.text: I have had this bag for 4 years. It is my go-to bag for work and carries a heavy load most of the time. It has held up well for those 4 years but after time the straps started to fray and separate at the shoulders. I contacted the manufacturer via their website and not only did they replace the bag but they sent the replacement via 2 day air. 5.11 is a great company, with great products and support.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Mahaun

customer_reviews.title: highly reconmmended!
customer_reviews.text: Best bag in its price and size range in my opinion. I've used many "higher end" bags (maxpedition, camelback, vanquest, north face,etc) but this bag seems to fit the bill the best in terms of price, quality and features. I bought this bag to use as a bug out bag and with all my gear I take it out and test it. I took this bag on a 4 day trip into the woods and it held up great, it fit everything I needed (40lbs or gear) and was extremely comfortable in comparison to my previous b.o.b. (maxpedition vulture 2). I have absolutely no complaints about it and would buy again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: J thang and k thang

customer_reviews.title: GREAT
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is great. I read reviews on just about every tactical backpack out there and this is the one I kept coming back to. I have not been disappointed. It fits a lot and all of the storage is very helpful. I filled it like luggage and was able to fit 4 pairs of pants, 10 shirts, 10 sets of socks, 10 pair of underwear, all toiletries and even a pair of shoes in it for a trip! I know if for 3 days (full bug-out) but if you want it for travel it works great but may require it to be checked.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: I love this bag!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag! I'm using it for plein air painting. I love how it has pockets for all my supplies. One for brushes, one for cleaning supplies, one for measure measurement tool, etc. I love how it completely opens up - so, I can easily access all my tools. Although it is heavy when my supplies are in it, the waist belt and chest belt help distribute the weight. It will allow me to hike to remote locations with all that I need. I can even tie my tripod to the bottom of the bag. The only tiny item I think they should improve is the way the waist belt tightens. It is tough to tighten.
customer_reviews.author: LaurieH

customer_reviews.title: Stop beating around the bush and just buy it already!
customer_reviews.text: I won't bore you with lame pics and military mumbo jumbo, but I am active duty military and actually use the crap out of this pack. I've had it for a few months now and have used and abused it. It works well, has lots of storage, and kicks the hiney of every other pack I've ever owned. I currently have another 5.11 messenger bag for computers in my shopping list hoping someone dear to my heart will surprise me with it. I'll be sticking with this brand from now on. You get what you pay for. Buy quality y'all.
customer_reviews.author: jason hardwick

customer_reviews.title: Great bag
customer_reviews.text: In my search for MY perfect BOB/Travel bag, I poured over review after review of the Condor, 5.11, Maxpedition, and after watching hours of youtube videos on each series of bags, I settled on the RUSH series by 5.11. I wear the 5.11 brand pants and hats and love them. That was part of my decision. I am 5'9 and about 130. I am not a tiny girl and this bag fits like a glove. The straps including the waist straps are a lifesaver after loading the bag with 20+ lbs. It carries everything and then some including my SnugPak sleep system and tent. Read less
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bag.
customer_reviews.text: Got this bag immediately after returning the "Paratus 3 Day Operator's Pack." The Paratus 3 day bag i got was slightly a lemon as the stitching were not straight. 1 of the stitching went completely off course and another 1 that stitched a small portion of the zipper lip to the stitching course. Anyways, this bag can pack quite a bit, plus the open compartment that is between the molle webbed compartment and the main compartment can fit a jacket and something else for quick access. I'll Include a photo of it. I'm no expert in BAB bags, but this looks good.
customer_reviews.author: PurpleFox

customer_reviews.title: I love everything about the organizational aspect of this bag so ...
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about the organizational aspect of this bag so it kills me to give it such a poor review. The bag has no lumbar support what so ever leaving the entire weight of the pack on the poorly padded shoulder straps. If you are over 6' tall the pack is going to sit about 6 inches higher than the lumbar region of your lower back. I own many 5.11 products and was looking forward to their usual top notch quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 40 pounds feels like 5 pounds
customer_reviews.text: Used since day one as a tech tool bag. The inner mesh pouch is JUST BARELY big enough to fit my MS Surface Pro 3. I have several tools with sharp edges and points and thought this might be an issue but the material has held up with no rips or tears. I have loaded this up with as much as 40 pounds, with the chest strap connected, 40 pounds feels like 5 pounds. The shoulder straps are well shaped and adequately padded for carrying heavier loads.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Great pack.
customer_reviews.text: I like 5.11 products for their great construction and materials. This pack is well thought out and carries on that tradition. Note that the material used and the features on this bag add a bit to the weight so weekend warriors or survivalists using this only occasionally might want to choose a lighter pack.
customer_reviews.author: pkwy117

customer_reviews.title: Bag is huge! ... and heavy
customer_reviews.text: Excellent ASSAULT pack. I'm in the army and bought this as an assault pack. The bag is heavy and for 95% of customers I would say go with the 24hr bag. If your looking for an overnight in the woods bag there are a lot of better options. My plan for this bag is to be an emergency 72 hour bag when it's not being worked as an ASSAULT PACK. I plan on purchasing either a 12 or 24 as an around town/work bag.
customer_reviews.author: Duane W

customer_reviews.title: Like barely made it as a carry on
customer_reviews.text: Overkill for my weeklong trip to Seattle but I had everything in this bag. Worked as a really snug carry on. Like barely made it as a carry on. But again it was packed with 2 jeans, slacks, dress shirt, 5 shirts, underwear for 6 days, toiletries, tablet, misc electronics. Better usage would be an outdoors pack or bugout bag, in a pinch it works as a travel bag.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Pack, Built Well, Tons of Roome!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic Pack! My search for a good, eminently customizable backpack is over! Lots of space, built well. I have it customized with 2 Condor Gadget Pouches on each side and 2 Condor handcuff pouches on the front. I like to have tons of pockets to feel uber organized going into my workday. This pack, with the addendums, delivers! The pack has quite a bit of room. I like the middle fold out bag as well for dirty clothes after I'm done at the gym. Lots of interior zippered pockets which make organization a breeze. Highly Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Paul E. Harvey

customer_reviews.title: 2 years on, jam packed full and heavy
customer_reviews.text: 2 years on, jam packed full and heavy with all my tools and parts, seems to make a decent IT Electronics bag. i tote around sorts of adapters and cables and what not along with 2 old laptops. I wouldn't call it a "light load" neither would the people who warn me about back strain when they try to move it. It still haven't used all the little side and top pockets to full potential yet. Quality bag so far!
customer_reviews.author: cdoublejj

customer_reviews.title: Great pack and easily holds all my gear
customer_reviews.text: Very early review, but I purchased this and a cheaper pack to see if it was worth the extra cost. It was worth every penny. Great pack and easily holds all my gear. I am spending more on accessories now as I plan on using this heavily. The storage is unmatched, materials are high quality, and the compression straps are very well placed and do their job well. I have filled every pocket, can find stuff quickly, and never once said, "now why'd they have to go and do that?"
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: 5.11 Rush backpack is the real thing.
customer_reviews.text: My family and I went in on this backpack for a present for my niece who has been in the school marching band. She is now in a grade higher where she can now go on the road with the band. She is also getting into camping as she gets older. My family and I and my niece were very impressed with the quality and storage of this bag. We all agreed that this bag will probably last her through her collage years. Her father and I both have asked for them for Christmas. Excellent service, was shipped and received at the time I was given.
customer_reviews.author: SSLY

customer_reviews.title: Great quality...
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this tactical backpack. It was recommended to me by my oldest brother; he’s got a smaller one similar to this that he uses when he goes hunting. The backpack has so many useful pockets and slots to attach things to, and the carrying straps are nice and wide with padding. I will be using this tactical backpack as a “to-go” bag.
customer_reviews.author: B. E. Kellogg

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Bugout bag
customer_reviews.text: I feel like Marry Poppins when I reach into this bag. I ordered It has many pockets and the open pouch pouch in between the rear/big compartment and the front/small pocket really comes in handy for my bottles and quick toss on items. I’ve used it for multiple uses and I absolutely love this back and get many compliments. I would buy again without a second thought if ever in need of a use for another one. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Terry

customer_reviews.title: versatile
customer_reviews.text: love it. backpacked through europe with it. there are multiple velcro tabs on the outside where you can put your american flag on and your rank if you like. a lot, i mean A LOT of pockets. sometimes it seems there are too many layers and pockets and as organized as i am, i have to look hard for my stuff. it's a pretty heavy backpack when empty but it sits nicely on my shoulders with a waist strap and it can carry quite a load. seems to be very sturdy. i haven't been deployed with this bag yet so we'll see. definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ziqing Wang

customer_reviews.title: The velcro patches are great for flags and nametapes
customer_reviews.text: Enormous space for clothes, gear, tools, and electronics. I frequently travel and this is my go-to carry-on bag. The velcro patches are great for flags and nametapes, and the cargo net area can hold my 18" laptop snugly. Each of the side compartments will hold a tennis shoe in each, while the top smaller compartment will fit your phone and a small notebook. The internal compartments are perfect for the small bits and pieces of gear that always fall to the bottom of your bags. Overall this is a solid backpack that is very rugged and spacious
customer_reviews.author: Alex Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Well made and has a gazillion pockets
customer_reviews.text: Looks like solid construction and there are so many pockets, nooks and crannies that I am still losing items in it! Expensive but I have not found better
customer_reviews.author: Asanawa

customer_reviews.title: Bombproof Bag
customer_reviews.text: Used primarily as a B.O.B. but I've field tested it on a couple camping trips and will fit everything you need and more. Just be careful not to overload it with weight heavier than you can carry, because people tend to fill it to the top because it can carry a lot of gear.
customer_reviews.author: Chin

customer_reviews.title: Great construction, good materials
customer_reviews.text: Dont know about water resistance but I have a rain cover coming. Great sack and it is my rifle sack, I am loading it to 30+lbs for my morning hike with my dogs. Trying to et fitter at 70 with a failed knee op. It is working well and is comfortable to carry loaded.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick D.

customer_reviews.title: Whatever you want it to be
customer_reviews.text: Everyone knows 5.11 is the leading brand for tactical stuff. I have a couple that serve as my bugout bag and a diaper bag for my toddler children. I carry it everyday and what I like most about it is when you break it in feels like it can take on anything. I throw this thing around everywhere and it has never failed me. The yolk shoulder straps and the chest strap along with the waist strap help distribute the load I'm carrying. I don't know, I wish I can give more stars cuz this bag definitely holds up and won't give out. Love my 5.11 tactical rush 72 hour bag
customer_reviews.author: Lima Foxtrot

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this bag
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this bag! So many pockets, features, and cool things about it. I've bought it twice. The first one was stolen and I liked it so much that I had to repurchase it. I use it as a gym bag. I house the following in it: - 5 resistance bands - Weightlifting shoes - Basketball/deadlifting shoes. - Ab roller - Mini band - Chalk container - Fat gripz It can still hold lots more. It is extremely well built. Very durable and the padding is great on the shoulders. Would buy this bag over and over again.
customer_reviews.author: KAREEM

customer_reviews.title: Best bag for quality, size, and comfortability!
customer_reviews.text: Use this bag for many reasons! Camping I can store pretty much anything and everything I need for personal use, great for attaching pretty much anything and no matter how much you think you have in there, when wearing it the weight distribution is incredible! I can run around with a good 45lbs on my back without it feeling like I’m carrying bricks. I also have this as my prime BOB, and take it with me shooting quite often, so it can be used for multiple things and is extremely versatile. Would highly recommend if you’re looking for a STURDY, sleek, and comfortable backpacking bag, BoB, or just a 72 hour pack.
customer_reviews.author: Guns&Stuff

customer_reviews.title: Excellence achieved
customer_reviews.text: Never seen anything so well built in my life. I’m ex army and I’ve seen good and crap. This is a beast, excellent job 5.11.
customer_reviews.author: GEORGE H.

customer_reviews.title: Don't get the made in USA version
customer_reviews.text: Unless you want about a fifth of the features of the other bag. Just got mine today. It has no molle on the sides, hardly any organization on the inside. Pretty disappointing. I'm sending this back to get the Vietnamese version. It's a shame
customer_reviews.author: josh LAWS

customer_reviews.title: Military grade material. Perfect 72 hr bag!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome quality backpack. More than enough room with multiple compartments. Some are mesh which is perfect for seeing what you in them. Includes a dry bag area for either storing extra socks or gloves. Also can be used to put wet clothes in and keep everything else dry. This bag holds everything and then some with the pockets within pockets. Then molle attachment and there's a pouch between the front and back pouch that I've been using to keep my tomahawk. I've got a good 30lbs with room to spare.
customer_reviews.author: M Bickley

customer_reviews.title: BEST BACKPACK EVER!
customer_reviews.text: This is the greatest backpack ever made.... Extremely thick arm straps with shoulder support makes the bag feel 20 pounds lighter when wearing it. So many pockets its the organizers dream Zippers are solid metal and thick enough and do not catch. Only complaint is that the "laptop" section for the backpack does not seem to have soft lining Besides that this bag has more space than you can handle and I expect to have it for many years
customer_reviews.author: Jordan A Bell

customer_reviews.title: GREAT !!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a vet and 55 years in the old Boy Scouts of AMERICA. Used many packs over those 55years. This pack goes every were with me now. Bought my first one about 9 years ago. It's still in use and looks as good as the day I bought it. Family now has 3. I tried 4 other companies Bug-out bags but let friends have them that don't use a bag a hard and as much as my family puts them through. It is called a 72 hr. bag but I use it for even 2 week outings.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT bag, easy to organize
customer_reviews.text: I use this bag to hold all of my 'apocalypse' equipment. sleeping bag, camp stove, food, pots/pans, climbing rope, etc. I was a little hesitant at first, because i wasn't sure how i felt about the storage configuration. But this thing has pockets for days! The pictures don't really do it justice. I was able to organize my bag efficiently, and feel well prepared. One thing to be aware of, I did not find any of the pockets all that useful for a full first aid pocket, so I will likely be buying the 5.11 medical kit attachment. Over all, definitely a 5 star product.
customer_reviews.author: Vergil Daughtery

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Only one day of use for work. Like the compartments. side pouches easily hold hydroflask 32 oz. Plenty of space for lugging stuff for overnights including laptop, books, food and a change of clothes. Shoulder straps are great. not a lot of dangling straps. Belt folds in easily and is comfortable that way. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: David Mayer

customer_reviews.title: My go to pack
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best designed pack I have ever seen. Protective eyewear pocket, carrying handle, designed for a water bladder, lots of organizational pockets an sections, waist and chest strap, lots of molly straps, lots of space.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Best tactical bag in the world.
customer_reviews.text: Fits everything i had in my other bug-out bag... including, that bag. I would recommend 5.11 tactical to anyone. I would love to try their other products. This is comfortable, easy to use and is the best bag I’ve ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Cant go back
customer_reviews.text: I seriously can't go back to regular backpacks! The quality of nylon is extremely durable. Friend's cheap tactical is fraying like crazy. I've taken it on thousands of miles on a motorcycle. The pockets and molle is amazing i have so many things hooked up including their small shoulder backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Rivas

customer_reviews.title: I field tested this in various vegetations and lighting w/ photos and my friends and I all agreed the OD was better than the multicam
customer_reviews.text: Have a Rush 12 in multicam. WAY TOO SMALL for serious hunter. I field tested this in various vegetations and lighting w/ photos and my friends and I all agreed the OD was better than the multicam....here in the southeast swamps the OD disappears much better than multicam. The extra size is great for coats etc. when necesary...just have to be disciplined not to overload it.
customer_reviews.author: SQ

customer_reviews.title: Great Backpack
customer_reviews.text: A lot bigger than what I had thought it would be. Very comfortable to wear, even for a big guy like me. Wish it had one or two more compartments. I can place two water bottles one in each side compartment. Very nice backpack.
customer_reviews.author: timahh

customer_reviews.title: The bag that does it all!
customer_reviews.text: This pack is used for my shooting hobby. Is easily carries several hand weapons and even a break-down carbine! Plenty space for tools, cleaning suppliesnand ammo plus extra space water and personal items. An excellent bugout bag!
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: sick backpack!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is great. I'm a USAF pilot and have tons of backpacks that haven't met the standard in keeping up with everyday use. This is more related to needing lots of pockets and areas for organizing all my gear and gadgets that I always need when I fly. There are tons of mesh pockets inside and all the external pockets are quite roomy. There are some good video reviews of this bag on youtube and I would recommend checking them out and comparing other products to ensure you get what you're looking for. The MOLLE system is awesome, as I will definitely be adding some pouches for extra storage.
customer_reviews.author: SWAGflyer

customer_reviews.title: Good bag, crappy pack...
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of good reviews here, so no need to repeat, but this is NOT a bag anyone would want to carry for a long period with a heavy load. It has no suspension system like a real pack, it's basically a glorified bookbag with a lot of webbing to look all "tactical" Fine for going on family vacation, but not a serious load carrying bag. I have a lot of packs and have carried heavy loads for weeks, and this isn't one I would chose for any serious hauling.
customer_reviews.author: M. von Wahlde

customer_reviews.title: Amazing backpack!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing bag, very durable, water resistant, a bag that you can depend on when you need it the most. I love it, thank you very much. I will tell friends, co workers, and family how great this bag is.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B

customer_reviews.title: Lots of storeage space.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a bag for a 3 to 7 day trip. Sometimes I deploy to areas for disaster response. The 5-11 72 is capable of handling a trip for 7 days. For me that includes jeans, shirts, underwear, socks, personal hygiene items, flip flops and some other small items. The Condor 3 day assault pack is another choice, but the 5-11 had some features that I liked better. The 5-11 is a bit more expensive than the Condor. Quality is excellent, so far. The zipper work very well and it seems to be an excellent bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a very capable and versatile bag. I ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very capable and versatile bag. I will be using it as my EDC/Bug Out Bag. The have only two minor criticisms and I would hardly call the first one a criticism, which is that it has so many compartments that it can be confusing where you've stored which items - but practicing the use of the bag should take care of that issue. My second criticism is that the bag is not waterproof. This of course is something of a trade-off given the material is very strong and can take serious wear and tear, so it's something of a personal choice to go with this type of bag over a waterproof camping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Nick K.

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for any occasions.
customer_reviews.text: I order this bag for future camping trips and hiking. I’ve added about 20lbs of gear in the bag and it feels greats to wear. The padding on the back of the bag and shoulder straps are comfortable against my body. There’s also plenty of compartments so I can easily organize my gear accordingly. The thing I really like is the material that this bag is made of feels very durable and dependable. There so much I like about this bag and I highly recommend this bag for any occasions.
customer_reviews.author: sannamarlee

customer_reviews.title: The most durable backpack ever created
customer_reviews.text: I have terrible luck with backpacks, as they all seem to fall apart after a few months. Not the 5.11 series. This thing was designed with durability in mind. I've had this backpack for over a year now, took it with me with trips all over the country and it is still as strong as ever. I take this with me when I go to conventions, and I can literally pack everything I need for an entire weekend into this. Best of all, there is a laptop slot hidden on the backside of the backpack that keeps people away from getting access to it.
customer_reviews.author: Dirtt Coyote

customer_reviews.title: Won't find a better pack
customer_reviews.text: Awesome pack I used it for my trip to Thailand. No issues using it as my carry on but it wasn't overly full. Chest and hip belts were a lifesaver on longer hikes and the dual side pockets were great for water bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Houser

customer_reviews.title: THIS BAG IS HUGE!!
customer_reviews.text: I will consider this luggage over a backpack. This is a beast of a bag. Its overkill for anything I will ever need it for and maybe that is what I love about it the most. This bag will hold a small body in it if needed.. its that big! It almost feels more like 2 bags attached to eachother as the outter bag holds as much or more than most kids backpacks! The main compartment routes the hydration without any issue and the comfort once I have the bag on is amazing. I forget the bags size. Im fairly happy with this bag and am looking forward to seeing how it holds up!
customer_reviews.author: PsychoCabbage

customer_reviews.title: Durable, expandable, did the trick
customer_reviews.text: Nice bag I used on deployment. Loved the expandability and durability of the material and functioning. Put my name tape and a subdued American Flag on the back. Not sure how I feel yet about the split type with space in between. It was ok, but not quite useful all the time. Sides were great for water bottles and shoes. Sunglasses compartment rocks. VERY comfortable to wear. Gets pretty thick though when packed. However, the straps allow for a lot of tightening. black color nice for deployment and back home in/out of uniform. Black color collects dust though in the AOR. Held all my gear needed for over a week of travel into and around the AOR.
customer_reviews.author: King Funny Bunny

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't live up to all the hype...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bag with 3.5 stars. The mesh connecting the two compartments seems rather cheap and unlikely to last long. Nylon straping connecting with buckles to shoulder straps seems very poorly made and unlikely to last long. (That comment honestly applies to all of the nylon straping on the entire pack). The bag material (assuming it's the 1050 nylon/cordura as advertised) seems thin,cheap and also unlikely to last. I'm kinda disappointed about this backpack because it seems like the 5.11 is regarded for such high quality and honestly a lot of companies try to be and want to make similar products. Man, things are not made like they once where.
customer_reviews.author: GR

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I had already ordered (2) of these bags and also have purchased (2) of the 24 hour packs. The 72 hour packs are being used as emergency bags. I have owned a host of 5.11 products and have not been let down yet. I am sold on 5.11 craftsmanship and will continue to purchase their products without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... my old one I had for 5 years had great reviews so I bought it
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this pack to replace my old one I had for 5 years had great reviews so I bought it. It came very well packaged and a day earlier then expected so bonus points for that. Very well constructed pack I abuse this thing like it owes me money and it takes every but of abuse like a champ no tears or messed up zippers. I use it everyday for work and when I go out camping or any other reason I need to bring anything other then my wallet and phone. Fantastic pack I give it 5 stars this thing will definitely last me longer then my last marriage
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: durable and amazing utility
customer_reviews.text: Used it every day while deployed for 6 months and it is showing very little wear and tear. It is an amazingly designed bag with the right amount of zipper pockets and large pockets. I love the bag. It is a great tactical bag. Would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Cody H.

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS BAG
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS BAG!!!! It is seriously my favorite for any type of travel. It has all kinds of crazy stuff you could use for tactical crap, but i just use it for travel, it has TONS of spots to stick stuff. Update: 1.07.16 Still love this bag!!! Used it for my week long trip to Mexico this past August and it held everything i needed nicely! I tried ordering the Rush 12 for a day bag when taking the kids places, but it was way too small and i returned it and i will now get the Rush 24.
customer_reviews.author: Colby

customer_reviews.title: Quality...theres no substitute.
customer_reviews.text: This backpack exceeds my expectations. I wish the outside top pocket was larger but that's just nitpicking. Way better quality than the Explorer Tactical bag....that bag fell apart on me in the airport after 1 year of work. The last bag i had before it lasted 4 and still had to be forcibly retired. But back to this bag. The Rush 72hr pack is well, WELL worth the extra money. Just on the feeling of quality materials used. Its twice as thick as the Explorer. Dont be fooled by the rest.
customer_reviews.author: Yushawan Douglas

customer_reviews.title: My new Bug out bag
customer_reviews.text: This thing is pretty awesome, lightweight, tons of space, well built. Hydration options. I upgraded to this from some molle type gear. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: I hate Sunlight

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a duffle bag I've had forever, was worried if I'd be able to fit a week's worth of clothes etc., however this thing is a beast. I fit 7 shirts, 2 jeans, shorts, sweats, 7 boxers, 7 tanks, 8 pair socks, extra pair of shoes in the middle part, all my bathroom amenities and probably more that I'm forgetting.... This thing is awesome!!! Also, this thing is very heavy, but even with it packed full it is comfortable to carry on your back. Plus it's great because it's carry on size for airplanes.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Walp

customer_reviews.title: This bag is good for hiking, small trips, fishing not BOB
customer_reviews.text: I have the entire rush line this bag is awsome. I use it as my deployment bag for my work with the goverment and is pack with all my gear and still have tons of space to put things in. I have attached items to the molle and the straps and they holds up well. I have zero issues. The waist straps keep up there promise of distributing the load. This is supposed to be a 72hr bag but will keep you for about week worth of gear in the end as its done for me.
customer_reviews.author: Akiile Barthelemy

customer_reviews.title: Good quality pack at the right price
customer_reviews.text: Ibuse this extensively and find it to be very spacious good quality, enough said about 511. My only complaint is I wish it had better hip straps to distribute the weight to my hips.
customer_reviews.author: Jobe

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack to have whether its for a 72hour survival ...
customer_reviews.text: Coming up to close of a year with this backpack. Great backpack to have whether its for a 72hour survival kit, or holding equipment. Molle webbing is great to have to add some extra addons in case you need extra space. The pack does have a lot of space and I use it to carry my climbing gear, to and from home and the Fire Station with everything I need. Two small holes on the bottom of the main compartment, my guess is to help get any water inside the bag out, which is nice. Very well built durable bag with lots of space and organization.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Great Pack, The REAL deal at a bargain price!
customer_reviews.text: Great Pack. Extremely high quality and rugged. All the features you could want and genuine article from 5.11. I'm a bit of a backpack nut, alway buying another high end pack. A couple of reviews said they didn't get a genuine 5.11 but a knockoff, but I noticed that they got it from a 3rd party Amazon link, NOT shipped by Amazon. Maybe a lesson there for us all. I even got the free 2 day shipping as a Prime member. The only pack that I have that I like more than this is an Eberlestock J107 Dragonfly with all the accessories that cost me $700! This is a great pack at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: BPaul

customer_reviews.title: Dammm dats a big bag
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazingly well built bag. It feels like it can run a gauntlet and still be able to zip and unzip. Lots of room and pockets to store anything. I ran out of stuff to load on it after I switched from rush 24. Highly recommend this bag for a bug out. To big for school stuff.
customer_reviews.author: NickyG

customer_reviews.title: great pack, rugged
customer_reviews.text: Took on a 26 mile hike, great pack, rugged, will not fail you. I would not recommend this pack for long extended hikes like The Appalachian Trail or Mount Kilimanjaro. This is a bag in my opinion meant for a couple days or a week hike would be to heavy and a burden for any longer because of the weight, other than that great pack!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: 5.11 killed it with this pack. I use it as my luggage for our small family vocations. I can fit a lot of stuff and it’s build tough. I have a few things 5.11 and they have all held up to my abuse
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Well done
customer_reviews.text: I have had issues with 5.11's clothing line lately but either the packs are a different division or this one was made long ago, because it is fantastic. Pockets and organizers everywhere. Perfect for a Kit rat like me. Made my OCD happy.
customer_reviews.author: Soylentgreen

customer_reviews.title: 5.11 Tactical Rush 72 Backpack
customer_reviews.text: I was originally worried about the weight of this back when empty, as I am 5'5" and 125 pounds. Used it as a carry-on traveling in undeveloped countries and day trips. The weight distribution is excellent, love the pockets, accessibility is great. The material truly feels indestructible, no problems with seams or zippers as it is so well made. I already bought another as a gift. Highly recommended brand for any of the different packs.
customer_reviews.author: California mom

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality stitching
customer_reviews.text: Bought one made in the USA but the stitching is loose on left upper buckle stress point after one use (packed 2 sweaters, 1 pair of jeans, couple briefs and a laptop).
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: There are a lot of things that I love about this including the weight bearing hip belt
customer_reviews.text: Holds a lot of stuff. I use this pack for Search and Rescue work. There are a lot of things that I love about this including the weight bearing hip belt. The bladder compartment has a rigid back which allows me to put a 3L bladder inside and still be able to put it on my back with maximum comfort. This thing holds a lot. I always struggled finding packs large enough to fit all my stuff and my dogs stuff. I have room to spare. Don't pay any mind to the "water resistance". Maybe it is resistant but my stuff still gets wet inside.
customer_reviews.author: ACW

customer_reviews.title: Great Pack!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pack! I've taken it on several hiking trips and it carries my gear without any problems. I've also used this to carry my Tae Kwon Do gear to and from the gym and everything fits in it with room to spare. I highly recommend this pack for anyone looking for an upgrade or a first time purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: I've owned many bags and this one is the best yet. Serves well as a school bag
customer_reviews.text: I've owned many bags and this one is the best yet. Serves well as a school bag, all purpose "dad" bag and range bag. It's huge to the point of ridiculousness. I can fit 2 broken down AR15's, my pistol and a case of ammo along with 2 text books and a diaper bag. Yea, my load out is different these days, I get that. Point being, this is a no nonsense, well-made pack that is comfortable and can handle more than you need it to. Pricey but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey C Merkel

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Love It
customer_reviews.text: I just got this pack, but absolutely love it so far. It's sturdily built and everything I wanted. You get what you pay for here. It's an excellent product that will last me my whole life with a little care. Don't go cheap on something like this. Spent the extra $100 (or whatever) and get yourself a high-quality backpack. You'll be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: Calen Wilson

customer_reviews.title: A backpack with a lot of storage.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to get a larger bag with a molle system and this one have been in my list for a while and decided to get one when it went on sale. Have to say it's pretty impressive with the amount of storage available in this and the molle system allows for future expansions if I need it as time goes.
customer_reviews.author: GR

customer_reviews.title: I love this bag
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag, I recently went to visit family for the holidays and used this to hold 5 days worth of clothes and several gifts for the family, the main compartment is gigantic and the smaller pockets are all very large and can hold quite a bit. I would have rather purchased it in multi-cam, but the price difference was not worth it. Great bag, would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ron R.

customer_reviews.title: Don't pass it up!
customer_reviews.text: My 2nd one. Ive tried a bunch of different bags: DragonEgg, Maxpedition Falcon, Vulture, sling style and dual strap, Mountainsmith, NorthFace.... This one I keep coming back to. Built like a tank, opens all the way clam shell style for both main and secondary pockets, large side pockets and a ton or organization options. Worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Live-Laugh-Love

customer_reviews.title: Big and looks cool.
customer_reviews.text: Im 5 foot 7 and this bag is pretty big but not too big. IMO it’s too big for a EDC but perfect for as a carry on for my missions trip to Kenya. Holds everything I need for a carry one on and looks very cool. I added a name patch to mine.
customer_reviews.author: B. Apple

product_meta.title: 5.11 Tactical RUSH72 Military Backpack, Molle Bag Rucksack Pack, 55 Liter Large, Style 58602
product_meta.description: The RUSH72 is engineered to be a full featured 72 hour bag that provides ample space for gear and accessories while remaining rugged and reliable enough for extended excursions or tactical deployments.
feature_bullets: Tactical Backpack RUSH72 features military bag design, built from high strength, water-repellant rucksack made with 1000D nylon; 3342 cubic inch / 55 liter total capacity

This MOLLE military style tactical backpack is ready for patrol. Dual-zippered front and main compartments with glove friendly molded grip pulls. admin organization pocket to store maps, pens and documents.

This heavy duty large military backpack features a front pocket - 15.5 x 11.5 x 2 inch, main compartment - 23 H x 13.5 L x 8.5 inches, hydration pocket -21 x 13.5 inches, left and right side pockets - 16.5 x 6 x 1.75 inch
Adjustable dual density closed-cell foam shoulder straps; cinching waist strap and dual compression straps keeping your rucksack pack secure and comfortable.

The 5.11 Rush72 Tactical backpack can be used as a multipurpose pack, bag, range bag, hunting backpack, army backpack, tactical sling bag, survival backpack, hiking rucksack, or everyday outdoor backpack.
